alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ozark, eastern Douglas and western Howell Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 915 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Gainesville, or 20 miles southeast of Ava, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Plains, Bryant Creek State Park, Willow Springs, Gainesville, Pomona, South Fork, Brixey, Noble, Willhoit, Pottersville, Caulfield, Gentryville, Siloam Springs, Sycamore, Vanzant, Dora, Rockbridge, Drury, Zanoni and Hardenville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
